data.title: Prime Store
data.statement:
You arrive at the magical prime store, where they have infinite games: for each positive number, they have at least one game with that price. So, as long as your budget is greater than 0, you can spend it all on a single game.
You have [[N]] coins and want to buy the best (most expensive) game at the Prime store with your given budget.
But <<the store will only accept a given coin if its value is a prime number>>. Coins from 1 to [[N]] have values [[x1]] [[x2]] ... [[xN]]
What is the value of the most expensive game you can afford to buy?

Notes:
The "most expensive game you can afford" means "the maximum amount you can spend".
A positive integer X is a prime number if it only has two different divisors: 1 and X.
The first prime numbers are: 2, 3, 5, 7, ...
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loopline n x:int
write Answer (x may be prime)
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: [[N]] = Number of coins you have
<<Line 2>> : [[N]] spaced integers [[x1]] [[x2]] ... [[xN]] = The value of each of the [[N]] coins you have
data.outputDescription: The maximum value of a game you can afford to buy at the Prime store

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You arrive at the magical prime store, where they have infinite games: for each positive number, they have at least one game with that price. So, as long as your budget is greater than 0, you can spend it all on a single game.
You have N coins and want to buy the best (most expensive) game at the Prime store with your given budget.
But the store will only accept a given coin if its value is a prime number. Coins from 1 to N have values x1 x2 ... xN
What is the value of the most expensive game you can afford to buy?

Notes:
The "most expensive game you can afford" means "the maximum amount you can spend".
A positive integer X is a prime number if it only has two different divisors: 1 and X.
The first prime numbers are: 2, 3, 5, 7, ...
Input
Line 1: N = Number of coins you have
Line 2 : N spaced integers x1 x2 ... xN = The value of each of the N coins you have
Output
The maximum value of a game you can afford to buy at the Prime store
Constraints
1 <= N <= 100
1 <= x1 x2 ... xN <= 100
Example
Input
3
3 2 5
Output
10
